result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shankeya M McDonald

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shankeya M McDonald appeared by video.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Shankeya M McDonald.  Prosecuting attorney Mallory R Davis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 29.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Shankeya M McDonald appeared by video.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Shankeya M McDonald.  Attorney Mallory R Davis appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Bail/bond hearing. Defense counsel advises the Court a bail/bond hearing is no longer needed. Defense counsel requests a scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shankeya M McDonald appeared by video.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Shankeya M McDonald.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Angela Juarez- MPD Detective. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shankeya M McDonald in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Preliminary Hearing. Attorney Kuehn was recently appointed, and requests an adjournment. Preliminary hearing adjourned for cause to Branch 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Case set for a preliminary hearing on 7/29/22 at 1:30 pm. Court is down and unable to hear the matter. Case rescheduled to 7/28/22 at 1:30 pm. Parties notified via email, including Justice Point.

Court ordered no contact with SME
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Shankeya M McDonald in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Shankeya M McDonald in custody.  Sarah Mackenzie Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
